Documentation :

Folder structure:

Files should be imported according to the folder they live in, one after the other in the following order: to see the structure in Architecture.txt

In this folder structure many scss files use here.

you can use main.scss file to get all marged file or use indivisually .scss file to get only indivisual .scss file property.

main.scss           // all scss file marged in one scss file

style.scss          // only custom styles marged here
fontawesome.scss    // only fontawesome file marged here
webfonts.scss       // only webfonts styles marged here
Theme colors:

All colors are available as Sass variables and a Sass map in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

You can customize predefine theme color for your project requirement in scss/abstract/_theme.scss file.

you can add more variable in _theme.scss but remember also add this variable into theme-colors-map in scss/abstract/_variables.scss

CSS variables:

Here are the variables we include (note that the :root is required) that can be accessed anywhere CSS is loaded. They’re located in our scss/base/_root.scss file.

this root variable marged with Theme colors. if you add more Theme colors it's automatically added same variable name in css variable.

Breakpoints:

Bootstrap includes six default breakpoints, sometimes referred to as grid tiers, for building responsively. These breakpoints can be customized if you’re using our source Sass files.

These breakpoints are customizable via Sass—you’ll find them in a Sass map in our scss/abstract/mixins/_breakpoints2.scss.

$grid-breakpoints: (
  xs: 0,
  sm: 576px,
  md: 768px,
  lg: 992px,
  xl: 1200px,
  xxl: 1400px
);
Use this media query:

Min-width: @include media-breakpoint-up(sm) { ... }

Max-width: @include media-breakpoint-down(sm) { ... }

Single breakpoint: @include media-breakpoint-only(sm) { ... }

Between breakpoints: @include media-breakpoint-between(md, xl) { ... }

// Example: 
@include media-breakpoint-up(sm) {
  .custom-class {
    display: block;
  }
}

// output:
@media (min-width: 36rem) { 
  .custom-class {
    display: block;
  }
}
Containers:

there are three different containers:

  • .container, which sets a max-width at each responsive breakpoint
  • .container-fluid, which is width: 100% at all breakpoints
  • .container-{breakpoint}, which is width: 100% until the specified breakpoint

This container width modified with breakpoint value in scss/abstract/mixins/_breakpoints2.scss.

container-max-widths:

.container-max-{breakpoint}, which is maxium width in breakpoint

You can modify container max-width value in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

width and height:

there are different types of width and height value.

width and height modified with breakpoint value in scss/abstract/mixins/_breakpoints2.scss.

.width-{value}, and .width-{breakpoint}-{value}, you can use in classes

You can modify width value in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

// This variable affects the `.h-*` and `.w-*` classes.
25: 25%,
50: 50%,
75: 75%,
100: 100%,
auto: auto 

// example
< div class="w-25"> width 25% < / div>
< div class="h-25"> height 25% < / div>
< div class="w-sm-25"> width 25% in small device < / div>

//output
div {
  width: 25%;
}  
div {
  height: 25%;
}  
@media (min-width: 36rem) {
  div {
    width: 25%;
  } 
}
Grid system:
Flex:

this grid system are follow by Bootstrap’s grid system uses a series of containers, rows, and columns to layout. It’s built with flexbox and is fully responsive.

Use flexbox alignment utilities to vertically and horizontally align columns.

row           // use this class as parent class 
col
col-auto  
col-1 
col-sm-auto   // responsive col classs with auto width
col-sm-1      // responsive col classs with calculate ((1 / 12) *100%) of width

// Vertical alignment
align-items-start
align-items-end
align-items-center
align-items-baseline
align-items-stretch

// Horizontal alignment
justify-content-start
justify-content-end
justify-content-center
justify-content-between
justify-content-around
justify-content-evenly

// Reordering
order-fast
order-last
order-1
order-sm-1    // responsive order

// Offsetting columns
offset-1
offset-sm-1

// Row columns
row-cols-3      // row define with 3 columns 
row-cols-sm-3   // row define with 3 columns in small device
Grid:

this grid system are follow by custom grid system uses a series of grid, cols, gg, and span to layout. It’s built with grid and is fully responsive.

use grid class as a parent class.

use cols class as a child classes.

use gg class for grid gap.

use span class for span one or more columns.

grid            // parent class

cols-1          // column 1
cols-sm-1       // column 1 in small device 

gg-1            // grid-gap
ggr-1           // grid-row-gap
ggc-1           // grid-column-gap
gg-sm-1         // grid-gap in small device

span-1          // grid-column: span 1; grid-row: span 1;
col-span-1      // grid-column: span 1;
row-span-1      // grid-row: span 1;
span-sm-1       // grid-column: span 1; (in small device)
row-span-md-3   // grid-row: span 3; (in medium device)

// example
< div class="cols-sm-2 gg1"> 
  < div class="col-span-1"> content here < / div>
< / div>
Gutters:

Gutters are the padding between your columns, used to responsively space in the grid system same as Bootstrap grid system.

// use this class in parent class (1-5 range avaliable)
g-1     // Horizontal & vertical gutters      
gx-1    // Horizontal gutters
gy-1    // Vertical gutters
Margin and padding:

Use the margin and padding spacing utilities to control how elements and components are spaced and sized.

these classes are define same as bootstrap classes.

m-auto 
ms-auto
m-1      // margin in 4 sides
ms-1     // left
me-1     // right
mt-1     // top 
mb-1     // bottom 
mx-1     // left right 
my-1     // top bottom
m-sm-1  // responsive in 4 sides

same classes using with padding
Buttons:

Includes several predefined button styles, each serving its own semantic purpose, with a few extras thrown in for more control.

these classes are define same as bootstrap classes.

Note: you can customize more btn classes in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file. these classes are follow with $theme-classes maps. if you add more $theme-colors variable, its automatically generate more buttons with this variable colors name.

btn-primary 
btn-secondary 
etc...
Utilities:
set-background:

You can set text color as per background color in css.

@include set-background(use bg-color name);

// example          
div {
  @include set-background(black);
}

// output

div {
  background: black;
  color: white;
}
content gap:

You can set content gap.

@include flow();

in this () space you can set you gap value.

You can use also a css variable for set content gap.

Note: You can use flow class instead of using css property.

// example
< div class="flow"> font weight thin < / div> 

div {
  --flow-spacer: 0.5rem; // use css variable to overwite scss variable
  @include flow();
}

// output
.flow > * + * {
  margin-top: var(--flow-spacer, 1em);
}
div > * + * {
  margin-top: var(--flow-spacer, 1em);
}
Spacing:

You can set margin and padding value in css. set default value is 0.5rem.

@include margin();

@include padding();

You can customize predefine spacing value in scss/abstract/mixins/_spacing.scss file.

Note: if you set only value without specify position then use @include margin($value: 1rem);

Note: you can also use margin and padding classes with responsive classes to avoid using css.

// example          
div {
  @include margin();  // use dafault value 0.5rem in 4 sides
  @include margin(top); // use default value in top position
  @include margin(top, 2rem); // set value in top
  @include margin($value: 1rem); // set value in 4 sides
}

// output
div > * + * {
  margin: 0.5rem;
  margin-top: 0.5rem;
  margin-top: 2rem;
  margin: 1rem;
}
Border:

You can set border value in css. set default value is 1px #dee2e6 solid.

@include border();

You can customize predefine border value in scss/abstract/mixins/_border.scss file.

$position: false,
$width: $border-width,
$color: $border-color,
$style: solid

// example          
div {
  @include border();  // set dafault value in 4 sides
  @include border(top); // set default value in top position
  @include border(top, 2px); // set value in top position with border-width value
  @include border($width: 2px); // set value in 4 sides with border-width value
}

// output
div {
  border: 1px #dee2e6 solid;
  border-top: 1px #dee2e6 solid;
  border-top: 2px #dee2e6 solid;
  border: 2px #dee2e6 solid;
}
font-weight:

You can set font-weight value in css.

@include weight();

You can customize predefine font-weight value in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

Note: you can also use font-weight classes with responsive classes to avoid using css.

thin: $font-weight-thin,
exlight: $font-weight-exlight,
light: $font-weight-light,
regular: $font-weight-regular,
medium: $font-weight-medium,
smbold: $font-weight-smbold,
bold: $font-weight-bold,
exbold: $font-weight-exbold,
black: $font-weight-black

// example  
div {
  @include weight(thin); // set font-weight value use with mixins
  font-weight: $font-weight-regular; // or you can use with scss variable 
}

< p class="fw-thin"> font weight thin < / p> 
< p class="fw-sm-thin"> font weight thin < / p>

// output
div {
  font-weight: 100;
  font-weight: 400;
}

.fw-thin {
  font-weight: 100;
}
@media (min-width: 36rem) {
  .fw-sm-thin {
      font-weight: 100;
  }
}
font-family:

You can set font-family value in css.

@include family();

You can customize predefine font-family value in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

$font-family-base: "Poppins", sans-serif;
$font-family-heading: "Poppins", sans-serif;
$font-family-display: "Rancho", cursive;

// example          
div {
  @include family(base); // set font-family value use with mixins
  font-family: $font-family-display; // or you can use with scss variable 
}

// output
div {
  font-family: "Poppins", sans-serif;
  font-family: "Rancho", cursive;
}
colors:

You can set colors value in css.

color: color(primary);

You can customize predefine color value in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

Note: you can also use color classes to avoid using css.

// example   
< p class="text-primary"> primary color < / p> 
< div class="bg-primary"> primary color < / div>

div {
  color: color(primary); // set color using color function 
  (in this case only use $theme-colors map variables)
  color: $primary;       // set color using scss vaiable
}

// output
.text-primary {
  color: #0d6efd;
}
.bg-primary {
  color: #0d6efd;
}
div {
  color: #0d6efd;
  color: #0d6efd;
}
text-align:

You can set text-align value in css.

@include text();

You can customize predefine text-align value in scss/abstract/_variables.scss file.

Note: you can also use text-align classes to avoid using css.

start: left,
end: right,
center: center

// example   
< div class="text-center"> text align class < / div> 

p {
  @include text(start);
}

// output
div {
  text-align: center;
}
p {
  text-align: left;
}
Color Shade:

You can set color shade value in css.

tint-color(color, persentage);

shade-color(color, persentage);

shift-color(color, persentage);

// example   
div {
  background-color: tint-color(blue, 42%);
  background-color: shade-color(blue, 42%);

  background-color: shift-color(blue, 40%);       (> 50%  lighten  /  < 50%  darken)
}


// output
div {
  background-color: set blue color in 42% lighten
  background-color: set blue color in 42% darken
  background-color: set blue color in 40% lighten
}
Border-radius:

You can set Border-radius value in css. default value is 0.25rem.

@include border-radius();

@include border-top-radius();

@include border-end-radius();

@include border-bottom-radius();

@include border-start-radius();

@include border-top-start-radius();

@include border-top-end-radius();

@include border-bottom-end-radius();

@include border-bottom-start-radius();

// example   
div {
  @include border-top-radius(1rem);
}

// output
div {
  border-top-left-radius: 1rem;
  border-top-right-radius: 1rem;
}
Clearfix:

You can set Clearfix value in css.

@include clearfix();

Note: you can also use Clearfix classes to avoid using css.

// example   
div {
  @include clearfix();
}
< div class="clearfix"> clearfix class < / div>

// output
.clearfix::after {
  display: block;
  clear: both;
  content: "";
}
